security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and protocol template skill. Contains Python templates for Opentrons lab automation robots using the official Protocol API v2. No network calls, no filesystem access beyond its own directory, no command execution. Safe for use.

content.user_title: Automate Opentrons protocols for lab robots
content.value_statement: Writing Opentrons protocols manually takes time and risks human error. This skill provides ready-to-use protocol templates and API guidance for Flex and OT-2 robots. Scientists can generate liquid handling protocols, PCR setups, and serial dilutions in minutes.
actual_capabilities: Write Protocol API v2 protocols for Opentrons Flex and OT-2 robots
Configure pipettes, labware, and hardware modules (thermocycler, heater-shaker, temperature module)
Create liquid handling operations (aspirate, dispense, transfer, distribute, consolidate)
Implement PCR cycling profiles with thermocycler module control
Generate serial dilution and plate replication protocols
Define liquid types and load liquids into wells for visualization
limitations: Cannot execute protocols directly on the robot - protocols must be uploaded via Opentrons app
Requires Opentrons robot (Flex or OT-2) to run the generated protocols
Cannot access or modify existing protocols on a connected robot
Does not provide real-time monitoring or control of running protocols

use_cases.title: Create dilution series

use_cases.title: Program liquid handling

prompt_templates.title: Basic protocol
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an Opentrons protocol that transfers 100 microliters from well A1 to well B1 on a 96-well plate using a p300_single_flex pipette

prompt_templates.title: PCR setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an Opentrons protocol for PCR setup that distributes 20 microliters of master mix to 8 wells in a PCR plate, then adds 5 microliters of template DNA to each well using a thermocycler module

prompt_templates.title: Serial dilution
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an Opentrons protocol for a serial dilution across row A of a 96-well plate with a 1:2 dilution factor, starting from column 1

prompt_templates.title: Temperature control
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a protocol that uses a heater-shaker module to incubate samples at 37 degrees Celsius with shaking at 500 rpm for 10 minutes, then uses a temperature module to cool samples to 4 degrees Celsius

output_examples.input: Write a protocol that performs a 1:10 serial dilution across 8 rows of a 96-well plate
output: Parameters: 1:10 dilution factor, 8 rows, 11 dilution steps per row
Deck layout: Tip rack in D1, reservoir in D2 (diluent + stock), plate in D3
Protocol includes: Diluent addition, stock loading, serial transfers with mixing
Run 'opentrons simulate protocol.py' to test before execution

best_practices: Always specify the latest API level (2.19) in metadata for new protocols
Test protocols in simulation mode before running on the physical robot
Use meaningful labels for labware to make protocol logs easier to read
Include comments with protocol.comment() to track progress during execution
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode specific well positions without checking if they conflict with other labware
Do not skip tip rack capacity checks - verify sufficient tips for the entire protocol
Do not forget to set proper flow rates for viscous liquids like glycerol or DMSO

faq.question: Which Opentrons robots are supported?
faq.answer: Supports both Flex and OT-2 robots. Specify robotType in requirements as 'Flex' or 'OT-2'.

faq.question: What pipette types can I use?
faq.answer: Flex: p50_single_flex, p1000_single_flex, p50_multi_flex, p1000_multi_flex. OT-2: p20/p300/p1000 single or multi GEN2.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other lab equipment?
faq.answer: Protocols can control temperature module, magnetic module, heater-shaker, thermocycler, and absorbance plate reader modules.

faq.question: Is my protocol data safe?
faq.answer: Protocols are generated locally and uploaded via the Opentrons app. No data is sent to external servers by this skill.

faq.question: Why did my simulation fail?
faq.answer: Common causes: incorrect API version, invalid labware name, deck slot conflicts, or pipette volume exceeded. Check labware names match the Opentrons Labware Library.

faq.question: How is this different from manual protocol writing?
faq.answer: This skill provides templates and API guidance. It generates protocol code faster but you still upload and run protocols on the robot through the Opentrons app.
